alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Castle, northwestern Salem, west central Gloucester, southwestern Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 616 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Grove, or 12 miles north of Newark, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Middletown, Chester, Pennsville, Carneys Point, Elsmere, Kennett Square, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Oxford, Alloway, West Grove, Quinton, Delaware City, Newport, Arden, Stanton and Glasgow. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 1. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
